entries.title: What is Elide?
entries.content: Elide is a polyglot runtime built on GraalVM 25.0.0 and Truffle that executes JavaScript, TypeScript, Python 3.11, Java JDK 24, Kotlin K2 v2.2.21, Ruby, WebAssembly, and LLVM in a unified environment with zero-serialization cross-language interoperability.

entries.title: Elide Performance Characteristics
entries.content: Elide achieves approximately 800,000 RPS on Linux with cold start times of ~20ms in native mode (compared to Node.js at ~200ms). Cross-language calls have sub-millisecond overhead due to shared heap and unified GC.

entries.title: Supported Languages
entries.content: Elide supports: JavaScript (ES2022+), TypeScript (transpiled), Python 3.11 (GraalPy), Java JDK 24, Kotlin K2 v2.2.21, Ruby, WebAssembly (WASM), and LLVM bitcode. Enable with flags: --js, --python, --jvm, --ruby, --wasm.

entries.title: elide run
entries.content: Execute a script in any supported language. Usage: `elide run <script>`. Supports JS/TS/Python/etc. Add language flags if needed: `elide run --python script.py`.

entries.title: elide serve
entries.content: Start HTTP server with optional hot reload. Usage: `elide serve [script]`. Add --watch for development. Supports --http2, --http3, --tls flags.

entries.title: elide repl
entries.content: Start interactive REPL for any language. Usage: `elide repl [language]`. Examples: `elide repl --js`, `elide repl --python`. Useful for testing polyglot interop.

entries.title: elide init
entries.content: Initialize new Elide project. Usage: `elide init [template]`. Creates elide.pkl manifest and basic project structure. Templates available for different use cases.

entries.title: elide install
entries.content: Install dependencies from package.json and elide.pkl. Usage: `elide install`. Handles both npm and pip dependencies defined in project manifest.

entries.title: elide add
entries.content: Add dependencies. Usage: `elide add <package>` for npm, `elide add --pip <package>` for Python. Updates elide.pkl and installs package.

entries.title: elide build
entries.content: Build project for production. Usage: `elide build`. Add --native for GraalVM native-image. Creates optimized binaries.

entries.title: elide test
entries.content: Run project tests. Usage: `elide test`. Supports --watch for development, --coverage for reports. Runs tests defined in test files.

entries.title: elide native-image
entries.content: Build GraalVM native-image binary. Usage: `elide native-image` or `elide build --native`. Produces standalone binary with ~20ms cold start. Recommended for production.

entries.title: Fetch Handler Pattern (Beta11-rc1)
entries.content: The standard HTTP handler pattern for Elide beta11-rc1. Export a default function named 'fetch' that takes a Request and returns a Response: `export default async function fetch(req: Request): Promise<Response> { ... }`. Alternative: `export default { fetch: handlerFn }`.

entries.title: Request Object API
entries.content: The Request object in fetch handlers provides: req.url (string), req.method (string), req.headers (Headers), req.json() (Promise), req.text() (Promise), req.arrayBuffer() (Promise). Parse URL with `new URL(req.url)`.

entries.title: Response Object API
entries.content: Response constructors: `new Response(body, options)`, `Response.json(data, options)`, `Response.redirect(url, status)`. Options include status (number), headers (object/Headers). Body can be string, ArrayBuffer, or ReadableStream.

entries.title: HTTP Server Configuration
entries.content: Configure HTTP server via CLI flags or elide.pkl. Flags: --http2, --http3, --tls, --cert, --key, --port. HTTP/2+ requires TLS. Default port 8080. In elide.pkl: server { port = 8080; http2 = true }.

entries.title: Polyglot Import Syntax
entries.content: Import other languages using elide: protocol. TypeScript: `import python from 'elide:python'`, `import java from 'elide:java'`. Then: `python.import('numpy')`, `java.type('java.util.UUID')`.

entries.title: Python Interop from TypeScript
entries.content: Access Python from TypeScript: `import python from 'elide:python'; const np = python.import('numpy'); const arr = np.array([1,2,3]); const mean = np.mean(arr);`. Objects pass by reference with zero serialization.

entries.title: Java Interop from TypeScript
entries.content: Access Java from TypeScript: `import java from 'elide:java'; const ArrayList = java.type('java.util.ArrayList'); const list = new ArrayList(); list.add('item');`. Full JDK 24 API available.

entries.title: elide.pkl Project Configuration
entries.content: Projects are configured using Apple's Pkl language. Key sections: name, version, runtime { languages, vm }, server { entrypoint, port, http2 }, dependencies { npm, pip }. Amend base: `amends 'elide:project'`.

entries.title: Error: Language 'X' is not available
entries.content: This error occurs when trying to use a language without enabling its engine. Fix: Add flag (--python, --jvm, etc.) or configure in elide.pkl: `runtime { languages = new { 'js'; 'python' } }`.

entries.title: Error: Cannot find module 'elide:python'
entries.content: This error indicates wrong import syntax. Correct: `import python from 'elide:python'`. Wrong: `import { python } from 'elide'`. Ensure you're using the elide: protocol prefix.

entries.title: Fetch handler not detected (404 on all routes)
entries.content: Server returns 404 for all requests when fetch handler export is incorrect. Must be: `export default async function fetch(req)` or `export default { fetch: handler }`. Named exports like `export function handleRequest` won't work.

entries.title: HTTP/2 or HTTP/3 not working
entries.content: HTTP/2+ requires TLS. Server falls back to HTTP/1.1 without TLS. Fix: `elide serve --http2 --tls --cert=cert.pem --key=key.pem`. Generate dev cert with openssl or mkcert.

entries.title: Slow first request (cold start)
entries.content: First request is slow due to JIT compilation. JVM mode: ~200ms, native mode: ~20ms. For production, use native-image build: `elide build --native`. JIT warms up after first requests.

entries.title: SQLite not available in native mode
entries.content: SQLite requires JVM mode due to native library dependencies. Fix: Use `--vm=jvm` or switch to external database (PostgreSQL, MySQL). Alternative: embedded key-value stores that work in native mode.

entries.title: Whiplash (Elide 2.0)
entries.content: Whiplash is Elide 2.0, a complete rewrite in Rust. Uses V8 instead of GraalJS, Cap'n Proto instead of Protobuf. Target: sub-10ms cold start. Maintains Fetch Handler API compatibility with Elide 1.x.

entries.title: Whiplash Crate Architecture
entries.content: Whiplash workspace structure: elide-core (foundation types), elide-js (V8 via rusty_v8), elide-http (hyper + tokio), elide-rpc (Cap'n Proto), elide-runtime (orchestration). All crates use Rust 2021 edition.

entries.title: Health Check Endpoints
entries.content: Add health check endpoints for production: `/health` or `/healthz` for liveness, `/ready` for readiness. Pattern: `if (url.pathname === '/health') return Response.json({ status: 'healthy', timestamp: Date.now() })`.

entries.title: CORS Headers Pattern
entries.content: Add CORS for browser clients: Set Access-Control-Allow-Origin, Methods, Headers. Handle OPTIONS preflight: `if (req.method === 'OPTIONS') return new Response(null, { status: 204, headers: corsHeaders })`.

entries.title: Error Handling in Fetch Handlers
entries.content: Wrap handler logic in try/catch: `try { ... } catch (error) { console.error(error); return Response.json({ error: 'Internal Server Error' }, { status: 500 }); }`. Log errors for debugging.

entries.title: VM Execution Modes
entries.content: Elide supports two VM modes: native (GraalVM native-image, ~20ms start, production) and JVM (~200ms start, more features like SQLite). Select with --vm=native or --vm=jvm. Configure in elide.pkl: runtime { vm = 'native' }.

entries.title: Testing Commands
entries.content: Run tests: `elide test`. Options: `--watch` for dev mode, `--coverage` for reports, specific file: `elide test tests/api.test.ts`. Uses built-in test runner with describe/it/expect API.

entries.title: Debugging Elide Applications
entries.content: Debug tips: 1) Add console.log(req.method, req.url) in handler, 2) Use --vm=jvm for more detailed errors, 3) Enable JIT tracing with --engine.TraceCompilation, 4) Check elide.pkl syntax, 5) Verify language engines enabled.

entries.title: Elide Showcases
entries.content: Showcase repository demonstrates Elide patterns: hello-world (basic), llm-inference-server, multi-tenant-saas, api-gateway-advanced, rag-service, circuit-breaker-polyglot. Most need elide.pkl manifests added. All should use Fetch Handler pattern.
